message.content:
cs.DC, cs.NI, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.IT. 

The paper presents deterministic protocols for the graph connectivity problem in a communication model where each node broadcasts a sublinear size message to all other nodes. This falls under the area of distributed computing (cs.DC) and networked systems (cs.NI). The use of sparse linear sketches is a technique from data structures (cs.DS) and the paper also discusses the complexity of the communication in terms of bits, which is related to information theory (cs.IT). Overall, the paper covers a range of topics that could fit into multiple sub-categories, but the focus on distributed computing and networked systems makes cs.DC and cs.NI the most likely categories.
